p: On admission to our hospital, the height, weight, and body mass index (BMI) of the patient were 170.4 cm, 90 kg, and 31.1 kg/m 2, respectively. He showed a red pharynx, swollen tonsils, and no palpable lymph nodes. His thyroid gland was elastic-soft with no swelling, nodules, or tenderness. He had severe myalgia and muscle weakness predominantly involving the four extremities; however, no redness, swelling, or local warmth was noted.
